item.title: The Astronomer's Dream
item.description: The Astronomer's Dream, or the Man in the Moon (French: La Lune à un mètre, literally "The Moon from One Meter Off") is an 1898 French silent trick film by Georges Méliès. Based on one of his stage magic acts, and starring Méliès himself, the film presents a varied assortment of images dreamed by an astronomer, focusing on themes of astronomy and especially the Moon.
